meanings.definition: The edge or boundary of something.
meanings.sent1: The borde of the table was painted in a bright color.
meanings.sent2: She walked along the borde of the cliff, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat right on the borde of the box, looking quite pleased with itself.
meanings.sent4: The borde of the forest whispered secrets to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The borde of the lake shimmered in the sunlight, inviting us to take a swim.

meanings.definition: To be adjacent to or alongside something.
meanings.sent1: The playground borde the school building, making it convenient for the children.
meanings.sent2: His house borde the park, allowing him to enjoy nature every day.
meanings.sent3: The two friends always borde each other during lunchtime, sharing stories and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The river borde the town, bringing life and vitality to the community.
meanings.sent5: The road borde the forest, leading travelers to new adventures.

meanings.definition: To provide with a border or edge.
meanings.sent1: She carefully borde the painting with a golden frame.
meanings.sent2: The tailor borde the dress with delicate lace trim.
meanings.sent3: The chef borde the cake with fresh strawberries, making it look even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The gardener borde the flower bed with colorful stones, creating a beautiful contrast.
meanings.sent5: The artist borde the mural with intricate patterns, adding depth to the artwork.
